definition: Mongol
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
blind/dim-sighted
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
(knocked) unconscious/dazed/stunned
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
surname Meng
drizzle/mist
surname Gu
ancient/old/paleo-
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
People's Republic of Mongolia (from 1924)
pinyin: Meng3 gu3 Ren2 min2 Gong4 he2 guo2

sentences.english: Most tof the inhabitants are Mongolian.
sentences.chinese: 这里的大多数人是蒙古人。

sentences.english: Of the 19 mummies examined, only three are Mongolian.
sentences.chinese: 检验的19个干尸中，只有三个是蒙古人。

sentences.english: Many Mongolians suspected a Chinese-style political squeeze.
sentences.chinese: 许多蒙古人怀疑这是中国式的政治施压。

sentences.english: Traditional houses of the Mongolians: Ger.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古人住的传统蒙古包。

sentences.english: Mongolian people don't have many written historical records.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古人没有多少文字史料。

sentences.english: At that time, the Mongols didn't drink tea while the popular beverage was the horse milk.
sentences.chinese: 当时，蒙古人也不喝茶，比较流行的饮料是马奶。

sentences.english: Therefore, a Han Chinese Mid-Autumn Festival subsequently overturned the anniversary of Mongolian rule predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 因此，中秋节也是推翻蒙古人统治的汉人纪念活动。

sentences.english: Mongols can drink up to ten liters a day.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古人一天最多可以喝10公升。

sentences.english: Se Muren became the Mongols and driven by the target.
sentences.chinese: 成为了蒙古人与色目人驱使的对象。

sentences.english: This large group was the Kalmyk Mongols.
sentences.chinese: 这一大批是“卡尔梅克蒙古人”。

sentences.english: After farming settled, there are new characteristics with Jalaid Mongol.
sentences.chinese: 扎赉特旗蒙古人农耕定居后，物资交易有了新的特点。

sentences.english: Fixed corrupt banners for Mongol strat units.
sentences.chinese: 固定腐败旗帜蒙古人启动单位。

sentences.english: Mongolian Americans have always followed Buddhism of the Tibetan (Lama) variety faithfully.
sentences.chinese: 美籍蒙古人一直信奉藏传喇嘛教。

sentences.english: Today Mongolian Americans are employed in a variety of professional enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 如今的美籍蒙古人任职于各类专业性企业之中。

sentences.english: But the short-lived, long before the Mongols to fight it because it needs horse.
sentences.chinese: 但是好景不长，没过多久，因为和蒙古人打仗需要马。

Mongolia

Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Turkic ethnic group
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
khanate (Mongol state)
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
